meanings.sent1: The cuspis of the pencil broke off.
meanings.sent2: Be careful with the cuspis of the knife.
meanings.sent3: The cat played with the cuspis of the feather.
meanings.sent4: The cuspis of the mountain reached into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The cuspis of the arrow gleamed in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A pointed or projecting anatomical part.
meanings.sent1: The cuspis of the tooth was sharp.
meanings.sent2: The doctor pointed to the cuspis of the bone.
meanings.sent3: The dinosaur had a large cuspis on its tail.
meanings.sent4: The cuspis of the antler was impressive.
meanings.sent5: The cuspis of the claw left marks on the tree.

meanings.sent1: The cuspis of the rock was dangerous.
meanings.sent2: She ran her finger along the cuspis of the blade.
meanings.sent3: The cuspis of the paper cut his finger.
meanings.sent4: The cuspis of the cliff overlooked the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The cuspis of the sword gleamed in the moonlight.
